item.title: Leonteq 首席执行官寻求扭亏为盈，预计 2027 年股东将获得回报
item.description: 瑞士衍生品公司 Leonteq AG 在公布上半年利润低于预期后表示，作为战略改革的一部分，该公司将寻求在 2027 年之前将多余资本返还给股东。【原文：Swiss derivatives firm Leonteq AG said it would seek to return excess capital to shareholders by 2027 as part of a strategic revamp, after it posted first-half profit that missed estimates.】

item.description: 据菲律宾财政局称，菲律宾正在利用移动钱包 GCash 出售小额政府证券，在筹集更多资金为债务再融资和不断增长的经济提供资金的同时，寻求扩大投资者基础。【原文：The Philippines is tapping mobile wallet GCash to sell small-denominated government securities, according to the Bureau of the Treasury, seeking to broaden the investor base as it raises more money to refinance debt and fund the growing economy.】

item.description: 亚洲投资级美元债券的收益率溢价降至历史新低，贸易紧张局势的缓解和强劲的企业基本面刺激了更广泛的区域风险资产反弹。【原文：Yield premiums on Asian investment-grade dollar bonds dropped to a record low, joining a wider regional rally in risk assets spurred by easing trade tensions and strong corporate fundamentals.】

item.title: 日本 GPIF 利用当前资产策略应对波动
item.description: 尽管美国贸易协议对金融市场造成了冲击，国内政府债券也受到了财政问题的影响，但日本政府养老金投资基金仍计划维持其资产配置目标。【原文：Japan’s Government Pension Investment Fund plans to maintain its asset allocation targets even as a US trade deal whipsaws financial markets and fiscal concerns pummel domestic government bonds.】

item.title: 越南认为特朗普关税将削减多达三分之一的美国出口产品
item.description: 越南政府的一项内部评估显示，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布的更高关税生效，越南估计其对美国的出口可能会下降三分之一之多。【原文：Vietnam estimates its exports to the US could decline by as much as a third if higher tariffs announced by President Donald Trump take effect, an internal government assessment shows.】

item.title: 美国在稀土问题上的举措推动了澳大利亚生产商林纳斯公司的发展
item.description: 中国以外最大的基本磁性金属生产商林纳斯稀土有限公司（Lynas Rare Earths Ltd.）表示，美国为削弱中国政府在该领域的主导地位而采取的举措，提高了人们对其产品的兴趣。【原文：Lynas Rare Earths Ltd., the biggest producer of the essential magnet metals outside China, said US initiatives to reduce Beijing’s dominance of the sector have boosted interest in its products.】

item.title: 新西兰央行称若物价前景缓和将进一步下调利率
item.description: 新西兰央行首席经济学家保罗-康威（Paul Conway）表示，如果物价压力前景继续如预期般疲软，新西兰央行准备进一步降息，并警告称美国关税可能会抑制经济增长和通货膨胀。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank is ready to cut interest rates further if the outlook for price pressures continues to soften as expected, chief economist Paul Conway said, warning that US tariffs are likely to damp economic growth and inflation.】

item.title: 贝森特将缺席本周重要的美韩贸易谈判
item.description: 韩国财政部周四表示，由于美方日程安排冲突，本周举行的韩美高级别贸易会议将缺少美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）的身影。【原文：A high-level trade meeting between South Korea and the US this week will be missing US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent due to a scheduling conflict on the US side, South Korea’s Finance Ministry said Thursday.】

item.title: 没有政策支持，中国煤炭价格暴涨的势头可能会减弱
item.description: 据领先的工业集团称，如果没有支持需求的政策，中国煤炭价格在政府采取措施解决供应过剩问题后的反弹很可能转瞬即逝。【原文：A rally in Chinese coal prices following government moves to tackle excess supply will probably be fleeting without policies that support demand, according to the leading industrial group.】

item.title: 韩国财政部可能在改革中失去预算权
item.description: 韩国经济和财政部可能会失去起草预算的权力，这也是李在明政府计划进行的改革的一部分，旨在全面改革一系列金融和监管机构。【原文：South Korea’s Ministry of Economy and Finance may lose its authority to draft budgets as part of reforms planned by the Lee Jae Myung government that look to overhaul a range of financial and regulatory bodies.】

item.title: 在重要的贸易谈判之前，中国对美国的关键能源进口接近于零
item.description: 6 月份，中国从美国进口的三大能源产品几乎为零；在北京和华盛顿恢复谈判以解决贸易分歧之际，这是一个潜在的敏感变化。【原文：China’s imports of three major energy products from the US hit almost zero in June — a potentially sensitive shift as Beijing and Washington resume talks to resolve their differences on trade.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行发现外国留学生增加了澳大利亚的住房需求
item.description: 根据储备银行的一项新分析，澳大利亚留学生对包括住房市场在内的经济需求产生了更大的压力，而不是增加了供应。【原文：International students in Australia exert more pressure on demand in the economy, including in the housing market, rather than adding to supply, according to a new Reserve Bank analysis.】

item.title: 特使称菲律宾将寻求将美国关税降至 15
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）设定的8月1日最后期限的临近，马尼拉驻华盛顿特使表示，菲律宾将致力于把美国对菲律宾出口产品征收的关税从19%降至15%。【原文：The Philippines will aim to bring down the tariff imposed by the US on Philippine exports to 15% from 19%, Manila’s envoy to Washington said, as the Aug. 1 deadline set by President Donald Trump nears.】

item.title: 降息有望将菲律宾债券从亚洲最低水平拉起
item.description: 由于菲律宾央行有降息空间，而且菲律宾债券相对不受美国国债走势的影响，因此菲律宾债券有望从亚洲债务排名的末位反弹。【原文：Philippine bonds are poised to rebound from the bottom of Asia’s debt rankings, thanks to the central bank’s room to cut rates and their relative insulation from US Treasury moves.】

item.title: 泰铢升至 2022 年以来最高，因贸易乐观和资金流入
item.description: 泰国铢升至三年多来的最高点，原因是对贸易谈判的乐观情绪不断升温、外资股回流以及金价接近历史最高水平。【原文：Thailand’s baht rose to the highest in more than three years on growing optimism over trade negotiations, the return of foreign stock inflows, and near-record high gold prices.】

item.title: 韩国权衡美国投资承诺以削减汽车关税
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，美国和韩国已经讨论过建立一个投资美国项目的基金，作为贸易协议的一部分，这与日本周二与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普达成的协议类似。【原文：The US and South Korea have discussed creating a fund to invest in American projects as part of a trade deal, similar to an agreement Japan struck Tuesday with President Donald Trump, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 托德-布利支持的 Accelerant 公司和控股公司在首次公开募股中募集 7.24 亿美元资金
item.description: Accelerant Holdings 及其部分支持者在美国首次公开募股中筹集了 7.24 亿美元，价格高于市场定价范围，这是最近一次与保险相关的上市，需求旺盛。【原文：Accelerant Holdings and some of its backers raised $724 million in an upsized US initial public offering priced above the marketed range, the latest insurance-related listing to meet with strong demand.】
